description: Evelyn Farkas, Executive Director of the McCain Institute, states it does feel like we are closer to a Ukraine, Russia peace deal due to Ukraine making various concessions. Farkas talks Ukraine backing off joining NATO sometime in the future, if other security guarantees will make this deal happen, and Russia not making a single concession since peace plans started. Evelyn speaks with Joe Mathieu on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Skeptical of Russia in Ukraine Peace Deal: Farkas

author: Oscar Medina, Andreina Itriago
description: Colombia’s powerful Centro Democrático party selected Senator Paloma Valencia as its candidate for next year’s presidential elections, signaling a shift toward a more moderate right as it prepares to face President Gustavo Petro’s preferred successor.
title: Uribe’s Party Picks Moderate Candidate for Colombia Election

description: National Grid New York President Sally Librera joins Bloomberg Businessweek Daily to discuss growing demands on America's power grid as data centers for AI technology become more widespread. Librera also discusses how manufacturing power needs in New York are boosting grid demands state-wide, how grids can be updated, balancing new infrastructure needs while keeping customer costs low, and more. She speaks with Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: National Grid NY President on Growing Energy Demands

author: Lucy White
description: The UK finalized a long-awaited free trade agreement with South Korea that the government said would boost exporters from automaker Bentley to beverages firm Diageo.
title: UK Seals South Korea Trade Deal Ensuring 98% Goods Tariff-Free

description: President Donald Trump says a deal to end Russia’s war in Ukraine is closer than ever after talks today. Trump says he recently spoke to Russia's President Vladimir Putin. Trump spoke in the Oval Office. US and Ukrainian officials are meeting in Berlin.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: End of War in Ukraine Is Closer Than Ever, Trump Says

author: Annie Massa, Misha Savic
description: Jared Kushner’s private equity firm, Affinity Partners, dropped its plans for a hotel in Serbia, after tensions around the project culminated in the indictment of a government official who helped clear a path for its development.
title: Kushner Scraps Trump Tower Belgrade After Officials Indicted

author: Nick Turner
description: Intel Corp. named Robin Colwell as senior vice president of government affairs, enlisting a Trump administration official to oversee the chipmaker’s relationship with policymakers and regulators.
title: Intel Enlists Trump Official to Oversee Government Affairs

description: President Donald Trump stands by comments ridiculing murdered Hollywood impresario Rob Reiner and his wife on Monday during an event in the Oval Office. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Defends Comments About 'Deranged' Rob Reiner

author: Nathan R Dean
description: Legislation will mostly take a backseat to midterm election campaigning.
title: Crypto, Tariffs and Regulation on Washington’s 2026 Agenda

author: Gerry Smith
description: The US Food and Drug Administration has no plans to put a “black box” warning on Covid vaccines, the agency’s top official said, despite a recent report that US regulators were preparing to add a new caution to the immunizations.
title: FDA Chief Says No Plans to Put Boxed Warning on Covid Vaccines

author: Courtney Subramanian
description: President Donald Trump said he felt “badly” about Jimmy Lai’s conviction in a Hong Kong trial and that he had previously asked Chinese leader Xi Jinping to consider releasing the former media mogul.
title: Trump Says He Feels ‘Badly’ About Jimmy Lai After Guilty Verdict

description: Trump spoke during a Mexican Border Defense medal presentation at the White House in Washington, DC. He said   he is “strongly” looking at an executive order directing federal agencies to reclassify marijuana as a less dangerous drug. he also said he was classifying fentanyl as a “weapon of mass destruction” in his latest push to ratchet up pressure on Latin America over drug trafficking. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Confirms He’s Considering Marijuana Reclassification Order (Q&A)

author: Scott Squires, Michael O'Boyle
description: Companies in Mexico’s power sector are sounding the alarm after the government published a draft proposal that would force them to sell electricity to state-run Comision Federal de Electricidad and potentially open the door for a government takeover of some power plants.
title: Mexico Plan to Centralize Power Contracts Sparks Company Outcry

author: Ken Parks
description: The US and Paraguay signed a security pact Monday that could allow US soldiers to operate in the South American nation as part of President Donald Trump’s crackdown on violent criminal gangs his administration considers terrorists.
title: US, Paraguay Deepen Ties With Pact to Fight Criminal Groups

description: US Attorney General Pam Bondi said that federal agents stopped a planned New Year’s Eve bombing campaign in Southern California, arresting suspected members of a group accused of preparing improvised explosive devices for coordinated attacks. FBI Assistant Director in Charge Akil Davis speaks at a press conference about the arrests. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Federal Agents Break Up New Year's Eve Bomb Plot in California

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he planned to file his lawsuit against the British Broadcasting Corp. in the coming hours, suggesting the UK broadcaster had not appeased him with its apology.
title: Trump Says He Plans to File BBC Lawsuit Monday or Tuesday

description:
The Trump administration is poised to undo Biden-era fuel efficiency standards it blames for driving up the cost of new cars, according to people familiar with the matter. 
 John Bozzella, President and CEO of the Alliance For Automotive Innovation joins to discuss the future of the US car market and how Trump wants Asia's "cute" Kei Cars mad and sold in the US. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump to Ease Mileage Rules in Bid to Curb Rising Car Prices

author: Courtney Subramanian
description: President Donald Trump said he was classifying fentanyl as a “weapon of mass destruction” in his latest push to ratchet up pressure on Latin America over drug trafficking.
title: Trump Says He Will Classify Fentanyl as Weapon of Mass Destruction

description: Netflix co-CEOs Greg Peters and Ted Sarandos said the company's bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. will result in "no overlap or studio closures." Peters and Sarandos said they were committed to releasing Warner Bros. movies in theaters and claimed the deal is pro-consumer, pro-innovation, pro-worker, pro-creator, and pro-growth. Bloomberg's Chris Palmeri joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Netflix CEOs Promise 'No Studio Closures' in WBD Bid

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A US trade court has denied a request to suspend a customs process for finalizing import duties while the US Supreme Court decides whether to strike down President Donald Trump’s global tariffs.
title: US Trade Court Won’t Pause Customs Process Amid Tariff Fight

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the latest from DC. On today's show, AEI Nonresident Senior Fellow Heather Conley, Republican Congressman Troy Downing of Montana, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Harvard Kennedy School's Ash Center Visiting Democracy Fellow Jeanne Sheehan Zaino and Alliance For Automotive Innovation President and CEO John Bozzella. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Zelenskiy, European Leaders Meet | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/15/2025

author: James Attwood
description: Chileans on Sunday picked right-winger Jose Antonio Kast to head the country. Now, the mining industry is focused on who he will choose to lead state copper giant Codelco.
title: Codelco Leadership in Focus as Chile Voters Shift to Right

description:
House Republicans plan to vote this week on a package of proposals to address rising health-care costs, but an extension of expiring Obamacare subsidies is conspicuously absent. The package would require more transparency from pharmacy benefit managers, codify association health plans, support self-insured health care models, and fund cost sharing reductions, according to House Republican leadership aides. 

Congressman Troy Downing, Republican representing Montana's 2nd District join to discuss health care and the future of Affordable Care Act premium tax credits. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Congress Faces Packed Agenda As Health Care Fight Continues

description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado speaks after accepting the Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo, Norway. Her daughter had accepted the award on her behalf. Machado, 58, had been in hiding in Venezuela since August 2024, saying she feared for her life after the movement she led presented evidence that her stand-in candidate in last year’s election, Edmundo González, defeated President Nicolás Maduro by a landslide. The socialist ruler instead declared himself the winner and launched a repression campaign against his critics.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Venezuelan Activist Machado Hopes Her Country 'Will be Free'

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The United Nations has cut food rations for people in Gaza by half, citing Israeli restrictions that continue to impact the organization’s humanitarian efforts.
title: UN Halves Food Rations in Gaza Due to Israeli Restrictions

description:
Heather Conley, a former State Department official, said any deal to halt Russia's war in Ukraine will be unsustainable in the long term without any concessions from Mosco.

 US negotiators offered more substantial security guarantees to Kyiv as part of President Donald Trump’s renewed push to end the Russia-Ukraine war, but the effort still appeared part of a bid to pressure President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on territory.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: US Offers Security Deal in Ukraine Talks But Territory Still Key

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey shot down an unmanned aerial vehicle over the Black Sea approaching its airspace, a rare military intervention by the NATO member amid regional tensions.
title: Turkish F-16 Jets Shoot Down Stray Drone Over Black Sea

author: Patrick Gillespie, David Feliba
description: President Javier Milei’s government unveiled changes to its currency policy and said it will embark on a campaign to build up its depleted foreign reserves, moving a step closer to the free float investors have long desired.
title: Argentina to Loosen Its Currency Policy and Build Reserves

author: Kate Sullivan, Michael Nienaber, Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: US negotiators offered more substantial security guarantees to Kyiv as part of President Donald Trump’s renewed push to end the Russia-Ukraine war, but the effort still appeared part of a bid to pressure President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on territory.
title: US Offers Security Deal in Ukraine Talks But Territory Still Key

description: Barclays US Economic Research VP Pooja Sriram says it's too soon for the Federal Reserve to claim victory over inflation. She speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Fed Can't Claim Victory Over Inflation Yet, Sriram Says

author: Fabiola Zerpa
description: Venezuela’s state oil company is still struggling to restore key administrative systems after what it called a cyberattack that hit over the weekend.
title: Venezuela Says Oil Export System Down After Weekend Cyberattack

description: Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac have added billions of dollars of mortgage-backed securities and home loans to their balance sheets in recent months, fueling speculation they could be preparing for a potential public offering. Bloomberg's Scott Carpenter reports.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Fannie, Freddie Expand Portfolios Ahead of Possible Public Offering

author: Daniel Hornak
description: US President Donald Trump invited Slovakia’s Prime Minister Robert Fico to visit the US in mid-2026 to sign an agreement that could allow Westinghouse to participate in a €13-15 billion ($11-12.7 billion) nuclear power plant project.
title: Trump Invites Slovak Premier to US to Sign Nuclear Power Deal

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukraine said its naval drones damaged a Russian submarine in the Black Sea port of Novorossiysk, in a special operation it claimed was the first such attack.
title: Ukraine Says Its Drones Hit Russian Submarine in Novorossiysk

author: Alex Wickham
description: The new chief of Britain’s foreign intelligence service MI6 accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of deliberately prolonging negotiations to put an end to the war in Ukraine, in an assessment that complicates President Donald Trump’s efforts to broker a deal by year-end.
title: New MI6 Chief Warns Putin Is ‘Dragging Out’ Ukraine Peace Talks

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukraine has intensified attacks on Russia’s Caspian region, hitting energy production and refining assets, amid ongoing talks to clinch a peace deal.
title: Ukraine Steps Up Attacks on Russian Energy Assets in Caspian Sea

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez used his annual year-end press conference to play down corruption and sexual misconduct cases hitting his party and government.
title: Spain’s Sánchez Plays Down Impact of Party Sexual Scandals

author: Justin Sink
description: President Donald Trump ridiculed Rob Reiner in a social media post Monday morning after the death of the Hollywood director and his wife.
title: Trump Appears to Mock Rob Reiner Death In Social Media Post

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russia declared the punk band Pussy Riot an extremist organization on Monday, according to a lawyer for the group, as the Kremlin continues a deepening crackdown on critics of President Vladimir Putin.
title: Russia Outlaws Pussy Riot Group as Crackdown on Critics Deepens

description: Maros Sefcovic, the European Commission’s trade chief, says China has started granting licenses with lengthier terms to allow European companies to obtain critical minerals essential for industries including clean tech, automakers and defense contractors. “We are getting initial reports from our industry that they are getting these general licenses but we need to have a little bit more granular information to evaluate the whole process,” Sefcovic tells Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook.
title: EU’s Sefcovic on China, Licenses for Rare Earths

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Polish President Karol Nawrocki warned his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskiy against taking his country’s support for granted, calling for a reset in ties between the two nations ahead of their meeting in Warsaw on Friday.
title: Polish President Seeks Reset With Ukraine in Zelenskiy’s Visit

author: Andra Timu, Irina Vilcu
description: Romania’s pro-European government survived another attempt by the far-right opposition to topple it in a vote of no confidence, leaving the fractious coalition in power as resistance to unpopular austerity measures grows.
title: Romanian Far-Right Fails to Oust Government as Tensions Mount

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Opposition leader María Corina Machado was injured last week while leaving Venezuela to receive her Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo, according to Norwegian news outlet Aftenposten.
title: Machado Injured Her Spine Escaping Venezuela, Report Says

author: Jorge Valero, Oliver Crook, Andrea Palasciano
description: China has started granting licenses with lengthier terms to allow European companies to obtain critical minerals essential for industries including clean tech, automakers and defense contractors, the EU’s top trade official said.
title: China Starts Granting General Licenses for Rare Earths, EU Says

author: Carolina Gonzalez
description: Chilean stocks hit a fresh record in early trading on Monday and the peso held near a 14-month high after ultra-conservative José Antonio Kast won the presidency by a landslide, heralding the nation’s most dramatic rightward shift in decades.
title: Chile Stocks Hit Fresh Record on Right-Wing Election Landslide

author: Alex Morales
description: Resident doctors in England voted to proceed with a pre-Christmas strike after overwhelmingly rejecting a government offer that fell short of their demands on pay and conditions.
title: UK Doctors Plan Strike This Week After Rejecting Streeting Offer

author: Arne Delfs
description: Germany plans to deepen its defense cooperation with Ukraine, including for the first time the possibility of acquiring weapons and battlefield data from Kyiv, alongside a potential peace agreement under discussion in Berlin.
title: Germany Plans to Work With Ukraine on Weapons and Battlefield Data

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa’s KwaZulu-Natal premier survived a no-confidence vote, keeping the province’s governing coalition intact and dealing a setback to former President Jacob Zuma’s party, which had hoped to take control of his longtime political stronghold ahead of next year’s municipal elections.
title: Zuma Party Fails to Oust Premier in Key South African Province

author: Lucy White
description: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK laid out plans to slash the civil service if his party gets into government, warning public sector workers that “serious weather” is heading their way.
title: Reform UK Unveils Plan to Cut Civil Service, Saving £5.2 Billion

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: President Donald Trump promised Americans big tax refunds next year. Many filers — particularly those who could most use the financial boost — may soon be disappointed.
title: Trump’s Promised Big Tax Tax Cuts Are Expected to Disappoint the Average Worker

description: European Union’s chief trade negotiator Maros Sefcovic discusses talks between the European Union and the US on steel and aluminum tariffs. Officials in President Donald Trump’s administration have made clear that Washington won’t lower tariffs on EU steel and aluminum unless the bloc eases some of its rules. ”We are going to protect our tech sovereignty,” Sefcovic tells Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook.
title: EU’s Sefcovic on Steel Talks With US, Tech Regulation

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: German shipbuilder Meyer Werft has clinched an order worth €10 billion ($11.7 billion) through 2033 with Swiss cruise operator MSC Cruises, according to Economy Minister Katherina Reiche.
title: German Meyer Werft Wins €10 Billion Ship Order From MSC Cruises

author: Ben Bartenstein, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union imposed sanctions on traders who’ve been pivotal to the trade in Russian oil, a step that may further complicate the flow of the nation’s petroleum.
title: EU Sanctions Lakhani, Eyyub for Involvement in Russia Oil Trade

author: Jorge Valero, Oliver Crook
description: The European Union’s chief trade negotiator said he would defend the bloc’s technology rules in a rebuke to US efforts to water down EU digital regulations.
title: EU Pushes Back Against US Efforts to Change Bloc’s Tech Rules

author: Taonga Mitimingi
description: Zambian lawmakers approved changes to the country’s constitution that alter the composition of parliament, eight months before the country holds elections.
title: Zambia Lawmakers Back Constitutional Amendment Before Election

author: Yongchang Chin
description: Singapore and China signed 27 memorandums of understanding and agreements to boost cooperation across financial and capital-markets connectivity, food security, and other key sectors, according to a statement by the Singapore Prime Minister’s Office.
title: Singapore and China Sign 27 Agreements to Deepen Bilateral Ties

author: Anthony Halpin
description: An offer to drop NATO membership bid puts the onus on Ukraine’s allies.
title: Zelenskiy Sets the US and Europe a Security Test

author: Ania Nussbaum, Jorge Valero
description: Emmanuel Macron’s push to delay a key European Union vote on the Mercosur trade agreement risks derailing the pact altogether.
title: Macron’s Delaying Tactics Risk Burying Mercosur Deal For Good

author: Andrew Kreighbaum, Eric Fan
description: President Donald Trump’s $100,000 price tag for new H-1B workers hired from outside the US will have punishing effects for the IT outsourcing and staffing industries that have long been a target of both parties.
title: Tata and Infosys to Bear Brunt of Trump’s $100,000 H-1B Worker Fee

author: Rajesh Kumar Singh
description: India introduced legal amendments in parliament on Monday to open its nuclear sector to private companies, accelerating a push to end a state monopoly over the power-generation technology.
title: India’s Parliament Takes Up Bill To Open Nuclear Sector

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand will hold a general election on Feb. 8, with pre-poll surveys signaling a fractured mandate as outgoing Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul bets that the intensifying armed conflict with Cambodia will bolster support for his conservative party.
title: Thailand to Hold Election in February as Cambodia Clashes Rage

author: Lucille Liu
description: China accused the Philippines of provoking a confrontation in the South China Sea after an incident last week that left Filipino fishermen injured, reviving tensions in the long-disputed waters.
title: China Accuses Philippines of Provoking Clash in South China Sea

author: Jaehyun Eom
description: South Korea’s National Pension Service will take a more “flexible” approach to strategic foreign-exchange hedging as it moves to shore up the country’s beleaguered currency.
title: Korean Pension Fund to Take Flexible Approach to FX Hedging

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia.

On today's show, Australia is in mourning after 16 people were killed including one shooter in the country's worst terrorist attack. Prime minister Anthony Albanese called the shooting an act of pure evil and said the government would take any action needed to tighten gun laws.

Ukrainian President, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, has signaled Kyiv could accept security guarantees from the US and Europe, in place of its long-term goal of joining NATO.

Former Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai has been found guilty of endangering national security in a landmark trial. It's a verdict that could fuel tensions between China and the US.

Today's guests: Charu Chanana, Saxo, Chief Investment Strategist & PolyAI CEO Nikola Mrkšić (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Bondi Shooting Latest: Australia Eyes Tougher Gun Laws | Daybreak Europe 12/15/2025

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand said it’s taking steps to restrict exports of fuel and arms through a checkpoint with Laos on fears the goods are being diverted to Cambodia as the border clash between the two countries intensifies.
title: Thailand Curbs Fuel, Arms Exports as Cambodia Clash Intensifies

author: Michael Heath, Swati Pandey
description: A day after the deadliest domestic terror attack in Australia’s history, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese faced criticism he didn’t do enough to combat rising attacks on the Jewish community nor swiftly enact recommendations from the nation’s antisemitism envoy released five months ago.
title: Australia’s Albanese Grapples With Fallout After Jewish Massacre

author: Angus Whitley
description: Anger over the Bondi Beach massacre spilled over as Australia’s Jewish community accused the government of failing to halt a years-long increase in antisemitism that culminated in the nation’s worst-ever terrorist incident.
title: Anger Simmers at Bondi Vigil Over Warnings on Antisemitism Rise

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: Switzerland lifted the growth outlook for next year on the back of its trade deal with the US, while lowering expectations on inflation after the central bank refrained from further easing.
title: Switzerland Boosts Growth Outlook for Next Year After Trade Deal

author: Lyubov Pronina
description: The European Union’s effort to tap Russian assets as the main source of international funding for Ukraine is becoming “increasingly difficult” as leaders struggle to agree on a framework, the bloc’s top foreign policy official said.
title: EU Deal on Ukraine Funding ‘Increasingly Difficult,’ Kallas Says

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Ukraine and the US are due to hold a second day of talks in Berlin on a peace plan aimed at ending Russia’s invasion, with allied security guarantees for Kyiv a central focus of the negotiations.
title: Ukraine and US to Resume Peace-Plan Talks With Focus on Security

author: Anthony Halpin
description: The Bank of Russia filed a lawsuit in Moscow seeking 18.2 trillion rubles ($229 billion) from Euroclear, the state-run Tass news service reported Monday.
title: Russia Seeks $229 Billion From Euroclear in Moscow: Tass

description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy signaled Ukraine could accept security guarantees from the US and Europe as a way to prevent future Russian aggression, and substitute for its long-term goal of joining NATO. Kyiv has altered its rhetoric amid continued reluctance of the US and some European partners and as Washington presses efforts to bring the almost four-year-old war to an end. Bloomberg’s Oliver Crook reports.
title: Zelenskiy Hints US Guarantees May Substitute NATO Bid

author: Paul Richardson
description: The parliamentary committee that oversees South Africa’s telecommunications industry called for the withdrawal of a policy directive that would enable Elon Musk’s SpaceX and other satellite-internet companies to operate in the country without ceding ownership.
title: South African Lawmakers Seek Halt to Easing Rules for Starlink

author: Sakura Murakami, Eddy Duan
description: China will take back the remaining two pandas hosted by Japan next month, effectively halting a program that has symbolized friendship between the two countries since diplomatic ties were re-established in 1972.
title: Japan Set to Lose Last Pandas in Symbol of Icy China Ties

description: Former Hong Kong media mogul Jimmy Lai was found guilty of endangering national security by the city's High Court on Monday. Bloomberg's Minmin Low reports on the latest. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Former Hong Kong Media Mogul Jimmy Lai Found Guilty in Landmark Security Case

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: South Korea’s former president Yoon Suk Yeol allegedly sought to prompt a military confrontation with North Korea to create grounds for declaring martial law a year ago, but the plan collapsed when Pyongyang failed to respond, a special counsel said.
title: Prosecutor Says Yoon Sought North Korea Clash for Martial Law

author: James Mayger
description: China imposed sanctions on the former top uniformed member of Japan’s military, accusing the ex-general of colluding with Taiwanese “separatist” forces.
title: China Sanctions Japanese Retired General Over Taiwan Links

description: Bloomberg's Paul Allen reports on how Australians are responding to the attack on a Hannukah celebration at Sydney's Bondi Beach. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Massacre of Jews at Bondi Beach Shocks Australia
